definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to win by a surprise move
to overturn empty convention, and display originality (idiom); new and different ideas

sentences.english: The mist-filled valley and flickering lights below looked strangely welcoming.
sentences.chinese: 薄雾笼罩的山谷和山下闪烁的灯光出奇地好看。

sentences.english: The bayonet squad made a surprise attack and wiped out the enemy's command post.
sentences.chinese: 尖刀班出奇制胜，捣毁了敌人指挥部。

sentences.english: It will happen by surprise in any place and time.
sentences.chinese: 它会随时随地且出奇不意地发生。

sentences.english: The temple persons aboard the palace all sent to go out, silence get startling.
sentences.chinese: 殿上的宫人都遣出去了，安静得出奇。

sentences.english: But the Olympic games have begun. Yabao Road is now strangely quiet.
sentences.chinese: 但是奥运会开幕了，雅宝路现在却安静的出奇。

sentences.english: Rachel : You are undressing very quickly.
One important reason for this was the unexpectedly high employee-turnover rate.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个重要原因是员工流动率出奇地高。

sentences.english: Now that the cheers had died away, the circus tent seemed oddly quiet.
sentences.chinese: 喝彩声逐渐平静下来后，马戏篷里安静得出奇。

sentences.english: In other word, they were surprisingly good-humored.
sentences.chinese: 这么说吧，他们的脾气出奇地好。

sentences.english: By a strange coincidence we happened to be travelling on the same train.
sentences.chinese: 巧的出奇，我们正好坐同一列火车。

sentences.english: But in Tohoku, as Japan's northeast is called, aid has trickled in agonizingly slowly," Beech wrote.
sentences.chinese: 但在日本的东北部，救援却出奇的缓慢”，毕其写到。

sentences.english: Unsurprisingly, the less people know, the more they run into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 人们知道的越少也就越容易陷入麻烦，这并不出奇。

sentences.english: Different strategies can be used in English advertising to draw people's attention and to win people over.
sentences.chinese: 广告往往以不同的语言策略出奇制胜。

sentences.english: Yabao Road is now strangely quiet.
sentences.chinese: 雅宝路现在出奇地安静。

definition: due to/to stem from/to go beyond (also fig. beyond reason, expectations etc)/to go against (expectations)
complete change from the normal state (idiom); quite uncharacteristic/entirely outside the norm/out of character
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
to appear to be/to seem as if
